uk.gov.gchq.palisade.redirect.service.impl

Class RESTRedirector<S extends Service>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.ws.rs.core.Application
      • org.glassfish.jersey.server.ResourceConfig
        • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.rest.application.AbstractApplicationConfig
          • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.rest.application.AbstractApplicationConfigV1
            • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.redirect.service.impl.RESTRedirector<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of Palisade service being redirected
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestFilter, javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseFilter, javax.ws.rs.core.Configurable<org.glassfish.jersey.server.ResourceConfig>, javax.ws.rs.core.Configuration, org.glassfish.jersey.ExtendedConfig, org.glassfish.jersey.server.ServerConfig, Service

    public class RESTRedirector<S extends Service>
extends AbstractApplicationConfigV1
implements Service, javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestFilter, javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseFilter
    This class implements the REST protocol version of redirection for Palisade services. Using the redirector module, it is able to redirect incoming calls to any REST call on any Palisade service by issuing an HTTP 307 TEMPORARY REDIRECTION to the desired server. The proxy REST client will then transparently redirect to the actual service location.

    The REST end point for Palisade that is being re-directed MUST have a constructor of the following form that all actual calls are delegated to: 

     

 {@literal @}
 public RestSomeService(final SomeService delegate) {...}

    The working of this class is a little complex so the flow of a request is as follows:

    1. Client makes REST API call to this redirector.
    2. The call is received and the pre-request filter will capture the host name of the client.
    3. The servlet container will send it to the REST implementation class resource.
    4. The REST resource will send the call to its delegate which we will have set as the redirection proxy.
    5. The proxy will receive the call and trigger the redirector logic to be called RedirectionMarshall
    6. The proxy call will return null or 0 as appropriate.
    7. The servlet container will call post-request filter which will retrieve the host to redirect to from the marshall.
    8. The post-request filter will change the response code to a TEMPORARY_REDIRECT 307 and set the Location header.

      • RESTRedirector

        public RESTRedirector(java.lang.String redirectionClassName,
                      java.lang.String restImplementationClassName,
                      Redirector<java.lang.String> redirector,
                      boolean configureRedirection)
        Direct constructor to allow for creation of a RESTRedirector with the given classes. The configureRedirection parameter is useful when you want to create a redirector without having it register Jax RS resources and perform any set up.
        Parameters:
        redirectionClassName - the class type being redirected
        restImplementationClassName - the REST implementation class for the redirection class
        redirector - the redirector instance
        configureRedirection - if true then the redirection classes will be registered with the JaxRS runtime

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public void filter(javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext requestContext)
        This is the pre-request filter. This is called by Jersey before calling the REST API method in the REST endpoint. We intercept this purely so we can grab the client hostname making the call. This information is set in the marshall so that when the redirector is called, the client hostname is available to it.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestFilter
        Parameters:
        requestContext - the servlet request information

      • filter

        public void filter(javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext requestContext,
                   javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseContext responseContext)
        This is the post-request filter. This is called by Jersey after the call to the REST API method has been made. Here is where we implement the actual redirection behaviour for HTTP. If the marshall states that a redirection has occurred (but not been retrieved) we replace the response body with null and send an HTTP 307 back to the client and set the location to the new hostname as given by the marshall. Otherwise, we just pass back the original response so things like 404 and everything else get passed back correctly.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseFilter
        Parameters:
        requestContext - the servlet request information
        responseContext - the servlet response information

      • applyConfigFrom

        public void applyConfigFrom(ServiceState config)
                     throws NoConfigException
        Gives the initial configuration to a service to allow it to configure itself. This method is called by the internal system to configure a service.

        Subclasses should override this implementation which does nothing.

        Subclasses should ONLY throws NoConfigException if a required configuration key is not present

        Specified by:
        applyConfigFrom in interface Service
        Parameters:
        config - the configuration
        Throws:
        NoConfigException - if some required element of the configuration is not present

        Subclasses should override this implementation which does nothing.

        Specified by:
